ratings.comment: He clearly has a passion for the subject which make the lecture bearable. He also has a generous curve on his exams. That being said at least one exam in the semester will destroy you, and everyone around you. He writes a lot of questions to trick you, take nothing at face value. Also he uses R, a computer program, which is pretty hard to navigate.

He talks to students like kinder-gardeners. Wastes the majority of classes doing proofs that we do not need to know. First half of the class is very easy and then the second just destroys you. You can understand him but I don't recommend him at all, Porter is much better.

This class is not an overwhelmingly hard class. If you are good at math, then you'd be fine. He is EXTREMELY picky on the homework. He's kinda hard to follow in lectures because he jumps around a lot. He does have generous curve on exams though. Also, his humor is overrated.

Very funny professor. Lectures aren't mandatory but I'd go to them. Not very clear on what to study for tests so that part was difficult. The final was a little ridiculous - there were some concepts we never learned. Homework grading very picky. Otherwise, interesting class and professor. If you like math or are good at it, you'll do fine.

He's pretty hard to follow in lecture but he's a really nice guy and is happy to meet with students. Exams are curved nicely, and if you really know the book material you'll be fine. Most irritating part of the class was how critically the hw was graded. Maybe it was just my TA, but getting a 100% on a hw was basically impossible.

Good Professor. Two exams and one final. The first exam is "doubled curved" and the second exam has a pretty generous curve as well. The final, content wise, is very difficult, but is curved as well. Do the homework, and try to pay attention in lecture and you should be fine.

Awesome professor- I was dreading having to take stats but he makes everything clear and easy to understand. He posts all his notes and you just have to fill in some parts, which makes it pretty easy. Do the homework and you'll be fine!
Very helpful always does his best to help each student. Class may be a bit boring, but best teacher to learn it from.

Kevin Packard is a pretty great professor. If you do the homework and practice exams you will at the very least pass the class and probably do well.  He's very easy to understand and posts note sheets online before class so you don't have to write every word he says.  Take him if you have to take stats!

Prof Packard is an awesome guy, someone you'd want to hang out with, but is definitely more of a high school teacher than a college professor.  His lectures are predictably boring but his humor is just enough to get you through.  The hw is much more helpful than anything you'll learn in class.  2 midterms, final, very nice curve.  You should be ok.

He is really great professor. He takes care of students. Willing to devote extra time after lectures, tries to explain clearly. Notes he uploads are extramly helpful. Great class. learned a lot. take it. do homework. attend. you will be fine.

Packard is THE best professor I had during my first semester at UW-Madison as a freshman. His lectures were not the most interesting-it is statistics after all-but he prints off notes for you, all you have to do is fill in blanks. And he genuinely cares about his students while also making the class extremely clear. Just refer to notes to do well.
Great guy.  REALLY nice curve.  Does his best to make a dry subject somewhat interesting.  Very clear and approachable.  Definitely take him!

Kevin is a great professor! Really helpful, nice, and he has a cheesy sense of humor. The lecture notes are all online, but you still need to go to class to fill in the blanks/examples. Exams are just what you would expect. Take Stats 301 with Packard!
He is very helpful and really nice, makes this class pretty easy if you go to lecture and do the homework. There is a decent curve as well.

I found this a great class to take if you have almost any decent mathematics background it should be quite easy to do well. As someone else said he organizes the notes amazingly. You do have to go to class to get the complete notes but the course mirrors the book so well you can easily teach yourself if you don't want to attend class.

This is a fairly easy class if you are good at math.  Kevin is a great professor.  He puts his lecture notes online, but you still need to go to class to fill out the examples which is a good idea anyway because you learn a lot from lecture.  Book is only necessary to do hwk.  Take this class with Packard.
